ml.alternet.security.web.server

Class FormFieldConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.security.web.server.FormFieldConfiguration

  • public class FormFieldConfiguration
extends Object
    Base class for handling form fields.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected String ctxtPath
      The path to the Webapp.
      protected Map<String,List<String>> fields
      A map of {path, fields}.
      static String J_PASSWORD
      Form field name for the password.
      static String J_SECURITY_CHECK
      Target path for Form Authentication.
      static String J_USERNAME
      Form field name for the username.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FormFieldConfiguration() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void addLoginFormValue(ServletContext webapp)
      Add the login form value if the authentication method is "Form" (that is to say, bound the form field "j_password" to the path "/j_security_check" in that context).
      protected void addValues(String path, String... formFields)
      Called by the extractor for each single parameter found in the configuration.
      protected void extract(ServletContext webapp)
      Extract the parameters from the Webapp configuration.
      protected List<String> get(String path)
      Get the fields bound to a path.
      static Optional<List<String>> matches(ServletContext webapp, HttpServletRequest request)
      Check whether the path of an HTTP request matches one of those found in the configuration, and return the list of passwords fields that have to be captured in a request.
      static Optional<List<String>> matches(ServletContext webapp, HttpServletRequest request, Supplier<FormFieldConfiguration> factory)
      Check whether the path of an HTTP request matches one of those found in the configuration, and return the list of passwords fields that have to be captured in a request.
      static void reset(ServletContext webapp)
      Remove this attribute from the Web application.

    • Method Detail

      • extract

        protected void extract(ServletContext webapp)
        Extract the parameters from the Webapp configuration. 
        <context-param>
    <param-name>ml.alternet.security.web.config.formFields</param-name>
    <param-value>
          /doRegister.html?pwd&confirmPwd,
          /doUpdatePassword.html?oldPwd&newPwd&confirmPwd
    </param-value>
</context-param>
        Parameters:
        webapp - The Web application.

      • addLoginFormValue

        protected void addLoginFormValue(ServletContext webapp)
        Add the login form value if the authentication method is "Form" (that is to say, bound the form field "j_password" to the path "/j_security_check" in that context).
        Parameters:
        webapp - The Web application.

      • addValues

        protected void addValues(String path,
                         String... formFields)
        Called by the extractor for each single parameter found in the configuration.
        Parameters:
        path - The path
        formFields - The fields

      • get

        protected List<String> get(String path)
        Get the fields bound to a path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path.
        Returns:
        The fields.

      • matches

        public static Optional<List<String>> matches(ServletContext webapp,
                                             HttpServletRequest request)
        Check whether the path of an HTTP request matches one of those found in the configuration, and return the list of passwords fields that have to be captured in a request.
        Parameters:
        webapp - The Web application.
        request - The HTTP request.
        Returns:
        If the request matches the configuration, return the list of field names.

      • matches

        public static Optional<List<String>> matches(ServletContext webapp,
                                             HttpServletRequest request,
                                             Supplier<FormFieldConfiguration> factory)
        Check whether the path of an HTTP request matches one of those found in the configuration, and return the list of passwords fields that have to be captured in a request.
        Parameters:
        webapp - The Web application.
        request - The HTTP request.
        factory - For creating a specific instance of this class.
        Returns:
        If the request matches the configuration, return the list of field names.

      • reset

        public static void reset(ServletContext webapp)
        Remove this attribute from the Web application.
        Parameters:
        webapp - The Web application.
